Subject: Hacking Outside the Box: Internet of Things
Description: With the emergence of the Internet of Things, pretty much everything you use on a daily basis -- from your car, to your thermometer, to your pacemaker -- are vulnerable to attack. Are manufacturers of these non-typical computing devices using good security methodology? Can you fool a car into unlocking itself with a simple setup? What other fun devices have computers that can be fiddled with for fun or profit?  Speakers include:Nick Farr, Jason Kridner - Track: Tech  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
